summary: This module implements error buckets for Apache's bucket brigade architecture. Error buckets store HTTP error codes and error messages which are used during request processing to represent and propagate error conditions through the HTTP request/response pipeline.

logs.reason: Creates an error bucket with the specified error message and HTTP status code. This information may be logged or displayed to users when errors occur during request processing.
logs.resolution: The specific resolution depends on the error message and status code. Check server logs for the full error context and refer to Apache's HTTP status code documentation.

logs.reason: Creates a new error bucket with the specified error message and HTTP status code. If an invalid HTTP status code is provided, it falls back to 500 (Internal Server Error).
logs.resolution: Ensure that valid HTTP response codes are being used. If 500 errors appear frequently, check for code passing invalid status codes to this function.

logs.reason: The function enforces valid HTTP response codes by falling back to 500 (Internal Server Error) when invalid codes are provided.
logs.resolution: If unexplained 500 errors appear in responses, check if code is attempting to use invalid HTTP status codes. Review the calling code to ensure it provides valid HTTP response codes.
